intro: Rubus sivasicus, commonly known as the Sivash raspberry, is a species of bramble native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
